testCases.explanation: Both trees have identical structure and node values
Same values but different structure: p has 2 as left child, q has 2 as right child
Same values but children are swapped at root level
Two empty trees are the same
Two single-node trees with the same value are the same

description: Given the roots of two binary trees p and q, write a function to check if they are the same or not. Two binary trees are considered the same if they are structurally identical, and the nodes have the same value.

examples.explanation: Both trees are structurally identical with the same node values.
Although both have the same values, the structure differs.
The values at the same positions differ.

constraints: The number of nodes in both trees is in the range [0, 100]
